pageContent:
DIVYA SRIRANGAM     
Salesforce Developer (SFDC) 
Plano, TX    
divya21sfdc@gmail.com      
214-430-2056 
 PROFESSIONAL SUMMARY: 
➢ 7+ Years of experience working with Sales Cloud, Service Cloud and Community Cloud 
➢ 5X Salesforce  Certified Professional (Platform Developer I, Platform App Builder, Administrator, 
Sales Cloud Consultant and Service Cloud Consultant) 
➢ Trailhead EXPEDITIONER 
➢ Experienced with Agile and Waterfall Implementation Methodologies 
➢ Development Experience with Salesforce Technologies such as Lightning Web Components (LWC), 
Aura Framework, Visual Force Pages, Apex Triggers and Apex Classes 
➢ Experience with Salesforce Integrations leveraging Rest APIs, Bulk APIs, and SOAP 
➢ Experience  with  working  on  Force.com  Platform  with  SFDX, Visual Studio Code,  Copado  and 
Change Sets 
➢ Experience  in  working  with  Salesforce  Workflow  Rules  and  Approvals Process,  Flows,  Process 
Builder and Salesforce limitations

Change Sets 
➢ Experience  in  working  with  Salesforce  Workflow  Rules  and  Approvals Process,  Flows,  Process 
Builder and Salesforce limitations 
➢ Experienced with AppExchange packages DocuSign and Conga Composer 
➢ User  Interface:  Salesforce  Visual  Force,  HTML5,  JavaScript,  CSS, Lightning  Aura  Component, 
Lightning Web Components, jQuery, AJAX 
➢ Experienced with Salesforce Sites and ETL tools (i.e., MuleSoft, Data Loader) 
➢ Development experience with VS Code with Salesforce Extension Tools, SFDX, Developer Console 
and Rest API Clients 
➢ Worked   with   project   stakeholders   and   gathered   business   requirements   and   customer 
expectations 
➢ Participated  and  delivered  on  all  components  of  the  SDLC  that  includes:  Planning, Analysis, 
Design, Development, Testing, Deployment and Maintenance 
➢ Complies with IT Security, Governance best practices and standards 
➢ Researches and/or implement requests for proposed system and architectural changes

➢ Complies with IT Security, Governance best practices and standards 
➢ Researches and/or implement requests for proposed system and architectural changes 
➢ Worked  on  solution proposals  for  procedural  changes  or  process  improvements  to  increase 
efficiencies in resolutions provided 
➢ Lead technology initiatives and drives them to completion 
➢ Adhere the Industry Coding standards and best implementations and frameworks

WORK EXPERIENCE: 
Salesforce Developer 
Amgen - Tampa, FL 
July 2020 to Present 
Description: Re-architected Amgen’s Global Healthcare Compliance System responsible for tracking and 
ensuring that all interactions between Amgen and Healthcare Professionals are in compliant with local 
laws, policies and regulations. 
Roles & Responsibilities:   
• Hands   on   experience on   Lightning   Components,   Lightning   Web   Components,   Application 
Integration and Events Creation using Aura Framework, Aura enabled controller and implemented 
controller logics 
• Created  modern  Enterprise  Lightning  Apps  combining  Lightning  Design  System,  Lightning  App 
Builder and Lightning Component features Amgen C3 (Compliance Control) Project 
• Performed the role of Salesforce.com Developer in the organization and consuming the REST data 
endpoints from the legacy SBA application to file upload into UCR Systems

• Performed the role of Salesforce.com Developer in the organization and consuming the REST data 
endpoints from the legacy SBA application to file upload into UCR Systems 
• Developed  several  Triggers,  SOQL  queries,  Apex Classes  and  Visual Force Pages  as  part  of  the 
application development 
• Worked on various Salesforce.com Standard Objects like Accounts, Contacts, Leads, Campaigns, 
Reports and Opportunities 
• Customized  the Dashboards  to  track  usage  for the productivity  and  performance  of  business 
centers and Amgen RAE (Amgen Employee) 
• Designed,   Implemented   and Deployed   the   Custom Objects,   Page Layouts,   Custom Tabs, 
Components to suit to the needs of the application 
• Created Custom Objects and defined lookup and master-detail relationships on the objects and 
created Junction Objects to establish many-to-many relationships among objects  
• Configured partner and custom community for the client and worked on lead management,

created Junction Objects to establish many-to-many relationships among objects  
• Configured partner and custom community for the client and worked on lead management, 
account management and opportunity management 
• Created multiple Lightning Components, added CSS and Design Parameters that makes the 
Lightning components look and feel better 
• Built Lightning Component Tab for Salesforce 1 Navigation and Custom Applications in Lightning 
Experience  
• Created community pages and added the lightning components for those pages 
• Created email templates and inbound emails using Visual Force for the clients and customers 
• Used Data Loader for data migrations to the Salesforce 
• Participated in the training sessions with support end users 
• Deployment through Copado 
 
 
 
 
Salesforce Developer

Health Care Service Corporation  
Richardson, TX 
January 2019 to June 2020 
Description:  Health Care Service Corporation (HCSC) is Blue Cross Blue Shield Health Insurance 
Company which operates in Texas, Illinois, New Mexico, Montana, Oklahoma. To serve the members 
and communities, HCSC initiated a Blue Door Neighborhood Center Program and selected Salesforce as 
Visitor Management Application. 
In order to manage visitor experiences, we have implemented following modules: Visitor Onboarding, 
Visitor Self Check In, Activity Management and Activity Scheduler.  
Responsibilities: 
• Involved in requirement analysis for application requirements to lay the guidelines for 
application architecture and data model 
• Implement Lightning with Aura Framework, Lightning Components and Lightning Apps 
• Responsible for Effort estimation, Development plan and Task breakdown in user stories 
• Implementation of the logic to incorporate Visitor and Visit Lightning Standard Objects with

• Responsible for Effort estimation, Development plan and Task breakdown in user stories 
• Implementation of the logic to incorporate Visitor and Visit Lightning Standard Objects with 
additional Custom Objects for activities 
• Single sign On Implementation with ForgeRock to onboard Community Users 
• Code review and deployment across multiple environments 
• Test Methods of Apex Classes, Unit Testing 
• Deployment through Copado 
 
Salesforce Developer/Admin 
Bank of America - Overland Park, KS 
October 2017 to December 2018 
Description: Implement the complete Business Affairs and Legal Affairs System for their Deal Request Life 
Cycle and also implemented the Contract Life Cycle Management (CLM), used the Apttus CLM capability. 
Responsibilities: 
• Led  discussions  with  the team  about  feasibility  and  effective  way  of  leveraging  Salesforce.com 
CRM features to best serve the purpose of the requirement

Responsibilities: 
• Led  discussions  with  the team  about  feasibility  and  effective  way  of  leveraging  Salesforce.com 
CRM features to best serve the purpose of the requirement 
• Developed Apex Classes, controllers and controller extensions to retrieve the data of number of 
people attending the campaign and their contact information 
• Used Apex Data Types, Variables, Expressions, Assignment Statements, Conditional Statements, 
Loops, SOSL, SOQL Queries, Control and Exception Statements to invoke Apex triggers 
• Developed  with  various Salesforce.com Objects like  Accounts,  Contacts,  Leads,  Campaigns, 
Reports and Dashboards 
• Used Batch Apex to build an archiving solution that ran on a nightly basis, looking for past records 
to a certain date and added them to the archival database

• Developed various Custom  Objects,  Reports,  Tabs,  Components  and  Visual Force  Pages  and 
configured the Analytic Snapshots to dump the data on regular basis for the sales performance 
and lead generation statistics 
• Created page layouts, validation rules, email templates, workflows, approval processes and lead 
assignment rules as per the Business requirements. Created profiles, roles and visibility settings 
• Implemented   and   used   Salesforce.com   web   services   to   transfer   data,   implemented   data 
migration using Informatica on demand and data loading using Data Loader, import wizard 
• Used the sandbox for testing and migrated the code to the deployment instance thereafter 
• Provide training and support to users on how to login, access and effectively use the System 
• Deployed customization and configuration using Force.com IDE and Force.com Migration Tool 
 
 
Salesforce Developer/Admin 
Hartford Life Insurance Corporation – Hartford, CT

• Deployed customization and configuration using Force.com IDE and Force.com Migration Tool 
 
 
Salesforce Developer/Admin 
Hartford Life Insurance Corporation – Hartford, CT 
December 2015 to September 2017 
Description: The  two  divisions  of  Insurance  House,  IIP  and  HLPP (collectively  referred  to  as  ISG)  use 
separate Saleslogix instances to track their CRM data. The ISG CRM project would create a “destination” 
type  web-portal  via  a  new  CRM  system  which  would  bring  together  all  pertinent  information  and 
applications in one location, providing easy access to tools and information. A primary goal of the ISG CRM 
project is to retire existing Saleslogix CRM functionality and replace it with a new CRM system. 
Responsibilities: 
• Led  discussions  with  the  team  about feasibility  and  effective  way  of  leveraging  Salesforce.com 
CRM features to best serve the purpose of the requirement

Responsibilities: 
• Led  discussions  with  the  team  about feasibility  and  effective  way  of  leveraging  Salesforce.com 
CRM features to best serve the purpose of the requirement 
• Developed Apex Classes, controllers and controller extensions to retrieve the data of number of 
people attending the campaign and their contact information 
• Used Apex Data Types, Variables, Expressions, Assignment Statements, Conditional Statements, 
Loops, SOSL, SOQL Queries, Control and Exception Statements to invoke Apex triggers 
• Developed  with  various Salesforce.com Objects  like  Accounts,  Contacts,  Leads,  Campaigns, 
Reports and Dashboards 
• Used Batch Apex to build an archiving solution that ran on a nightly basis, looking for past records   
to a certain date and added them to the archive 
• Developed  various  Custom  Objects,  Reports,  Tabs, Components  and  Visual Force Pages  and

to a certain date and added them to the archive 
• Developed  various  Custom  Objects,  Reports,  Tabs, Components  and  Visual Force Pages  and 
configured the Analytic Snapshots to dump the data on a regular basis for the sales performance 
and lead generation statistics 
• Created page layouts, validation rules, email templates, workflows, approval processes and lead 
assignment rules as per the Business requirements. Created profiles, roles and visibility settings 
• Implemented   and   used   Salesforce.com   web   services   to   transfer   data,   implemented   data 
migration using Informatica on demand and data loading using Data Loader, import wizard 
• Used the sandbox for testing and migrated the code to the deployment instance thereafter 
• Provide training and support to users on how to login, access and effectively use the System 
• Deployed customization and configuration using Force.com IDE and Force.com Migration Tool
